file_content.text: Hey, what, uh, what are you doing here?
You, uh, you should probably start heading for the refugee camp, Sergeant. We need to find out what Mirru knows--you know, ASAP.
Oh, uh, yes, we found an urgent lead while you were in Talloran, Sergeant. The perfect op for our new assault specialist.
What's the assignment?
I'm ready for duty, sir.
What kind of lead?
Why so urgent?
Uh, well, because it's not so much a lead, as it is a bomb threat....
Fine, I'm listening.
Here's what happened: This refugee comes into the fort, right? Not that unusual, but this guy says he knows about a separatist bombing--one happening today!
All we got was his name, Mirru--'cause he was thrown out of the fort before we could get to him.
I don't think throwing informants out is standard procedure.
Is that normal?
I take it the guy's intel was less than reliable, or else he'd still be here.
Sounds like a shaky source.
It's a real relief to know that we're so on top of things around here.
That was a stupid move.
Bums come here everyday, trying to trade "intel" for credits. It's bogus ninety percent of the time, so the grunts downstairs usually chase them off.
You think Mirru actually had some good intelligence for us?
But Mirru is different.
If we run off anyone who tries to give us information, we could miss out on critical intelligence.
Chasing away leads is moronic.
If these bums are lying to us, we should do a lot more than just throw them out.
All we do is run them off?
Let's just focus on the situation at hand, Sergeant. Fuse thinks Mirru is the real deal, so we're going with it.
I guess Mirru could be lying, but what if he does know about the ZR-57? We can't take that risk.
Anyway, we looked into it, and Mirru is staying over in the refugee camp. See if you can find him there.
Will do.
I guess I could look into this for you.
I've got nothing else to do.
I'll get everything this refugee knows.
Mirru will talk, or else.
While you're gone, Jorgan will decode the information from Bellis's field box. Hopefully we'll find out what the separatists are hiding.
Now get to the refugee camp and get Mirru's intel, soldier. If this bombing is happening soon, there's no time to waste.
Understood.
I couldn't mess this up if I tried.
This will be a breeze.
If only that were true.
Dismissed, Sergeant.
It will be easier to get my Medal of Valor if you start the paperwork now.
Get the commendations ready!
Dream on, Sergeant. You're dismissed.
Oh, Sergeant, hey, you're back! Good job out there in Talloran, really nice work.
I'll take the field box you retrieved, Sergeant. And maybe next time you could bring me a live Republic agent instead.
I did everything I could.
I'm sorry, sir.
Everything except keeping a vital Republic asset alive. You'd better not mess up like this again, Sergeant.
I'm not in the habit of repeating my mistakes, sir.
This won't happen again.
Good. I'm glad we're clear on that, Sergeant.
Maybe next time you could send me to meet with a live Republic agent, instead of a corpse.
I'm not the one who messed up.
That's enough, Sergeant! I want to make myself completely clear: This better not happen again.
Lieutenant Bazren here still thinks you're mission-worthy, so he has a task for you. He'll brief you while I start decoding Bellis's intel.
It's great to have you here, Sergeant, really great.
Hello there, Sergeant.
Oh, uh, hello.
